intro: Psychotria nilgherensis, commonly known as the Nilgiri Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments and is often found in undergrowth. It is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens. The species is also of interest in ecological studies due to its role in local ecosystems.
